intro: Camelina saxatilis, commonly known as saxatile camelina, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant has small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are alternate and linear. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Camelina saxatilis is also known for its potential as a source of oilseed for agricultural use.
